text:
Liberia Needs Human Resource Capacity to Sustain Development, Says Lipa DG Tagged: Cameroon: Douala - Suspected Hard Drug Network Dismantled By Ballah M. Kollie 
The Director General of the Liberia Institute of Public Administration (LIPA), Oblayon B. Nyemah, Sr., has pointed out that Liberia will not sustain development in the absence of the requisite human resource capacity. 
Addressing the orientation of the second cycle of trainees for 2015, Nyemah stressed the need for citizens to take advantage of training opportunities provided by the institute. Related Topics Cameroon: Douala - Suspected Hard Drug Network Dismantled 
LIPA has the mandate to provide capacity building for sustained quality service delivery through training, research, consultancy and information services. 
He cautioned participants to take serious their studies as it will enhance their service delivery capacity upon completion adding, "It will not be easy, some of you will complain due the intensiveness of the study but it will help you as you leave these walls." 
"Cardinal among the things that are giving us serious difficulties as citizens of this country is that we do not put much into research and development," Nyemah noted. 
He challenged participants to report all acts of compromise and violations, and warned them against acts of cheating. 
The institute put out more than 230 on July 10 this year as the first set of graduates which included candidates of several public institutions and corporations as well as self-sponsored students. 
Those orientated Thursday will be certificated upon the completion of eight (8) and sixteen (16) weeks of studies in various disciplines including Banking and Finance, Human Resource Management, Monitoring and Evaluation, Performance Management and Procurement. 
Other courses are Public Finance Management, Project Planning and Report Writing, and Internal Audit with participants coming from public institutions, while others were self-supporting. 
LIPA has the vision of maintaining its status as the nation's premier center of excellence in capacity building for sustainable development. Liberia
